item.title: HashMap
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

What else do you need to see? I called the method via a command. It’s a certain minigame. Here’s the HashMap.

[code=java] /**
* Hash map
*/
public static HashMap<Client, Integer> inWAIT = new HashMap<Client, Integer>();

    public static HashMap<Client, Integer> inCW = new HashMap<Client, Integer>();

public static int ingameroom() {
    int players = 0;
    Iterator<Integer> iterator = (!inCW.isEmpty()) ? inCW.values().iterator()
    		: inCW.values().iterator();
    while (iterator.hasNext()) {
        if ((Integer) iterator.next() == 1) {
            players++;
        }
    }
    return players;
}

public static int inwait() {
    int players = 0;
    Iterator<Integer> iterator = (!inWAIT.isEmpty()) ? inWAIT.values().iterator()
    		: inWAIT.values().iterator();
    while (iterator.hasNext()) {
        if ((Integer) iterator.next() == 1) {
            players++;
        	}
    	}
    	return players;
	}[/code]

I’m kinda new to HashMap, but i learn quickly.

Read full topic

item.title: HashMap
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Well, since HolyGrail* suggested for something to be given for the last player, i decided to add it. Here it is, but it won’t call it after the if(ingameroom() == 1) for some reason…

public void ingame(HashMap<Client, Integer> ingameroom) { System.out.println("after calling void, but no if's."); if (ingameroom() == 1) { c.sendMessage("@red@You are the remaining person and have recieved a "); System.out.println("the last person alive has been initialized"); c.sendMessage("@blu@"); // c.getItems().addItem(randomitem[Misc.random(getLength() - 1)], 1); } else if (CW.ingameroom() >= 2) { System.out.println("theres 2 players left and no more time end it"); this.endGame(); } }
